Reviews.Title: “Better to sleep in your vehicle”
Reviews.Author: Jennie M
Reviews.Content: A two night experience that convinced us that New Orleans is not worth our spending another dime there---EVER! Although the reservations were paid for in advance, they still insisted on scanning our card for "incidentals" and charged us after we left for two nights at full price. That would help to explain why they refused to give us a bill upon check-out after charging our card over $500 more. For the entire stay, we NEVER had a key to our room and was inconvenienced to have to wait for someone to let us in every time we left the room. Not ONCE was there enough food for any breakfast to be had. And the nasty swimming pool (the size of a small private pool) as they call it was off limits because we didn't have a key. The building itself is nice because it's only 7 years old, but no security in the $26 per day parking lot across the street allows the drunks and homeless to wonder about freely without any resistance. The location is good for the money, but a one night stay beforehand at Holiday Inn Express was more convenient and has more amenities. When asking about a key for the room, we were mislead and lied to repeatedly. Something they fail to tell you until they have scanned your card is check-out is 11AM, but check-in isn't until 4PM---if you're lucky.

Reviews.Title: “Great locale, horrible wireless”
Reviews.Author: JimCE
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for the casino, aquarium, IMAX, or insectarium. It is in the warehouse district and an EASY walk to all of the aforementioned places. The hot breakfast was really pretty good both days we stayed there. The room was pretty clean and was a good size. My only complaint in that department is that unlike at the Embassy Suites, the bathroom is inside the room with the master. We wanted a suite because we were travelling with our daughter. So, it would have been nice to have the restroom outside the master for her to use whenever she got up in the middle of the night. If I were a business traveler, the lack of speedy and dependable wireless would be a deal breaker. It was atrocious how slow and flakey it was.

Reviews.Title: “A simple and pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Rohlin
Reviews.Content: Staybridge Suites has a very underrated location. You're just across the street from Piazza d'Italia and Mother's Restaurant, a block from the casino, and roughly three blocks from the French Quarter. Be sure to park in the PUBLIC lot next door--parking there is $29, while Staybridge charges you $30. The good: The room was very spacious and I couldn't hear any neighbors. The location was far enough from the riff-raff that there were no issues related to that either. The staff is very friendly and accommodating, while the continental breakfast is delicious. The bad: When I arrived we went through four room keys before they gave up and assigned me to a different room. The refrigerator made a loud churning noise until I gave it a firm slap on the side. I also couldn't find any vending machines in the hotel. This was a very good stay for me. I was comfortable walking everywhere I needed to go, and the staff was very friendly. If I went back to New Orleans to visit the French Quarter, I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: jpsasha69
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Staybridge Suites for four nights and overall it was a good experience. The good: clean hotel and rooms, location convenient to both the French Quarter and warehouse district, hot breakfast every morning. The so-so: housekeeping was a bit hit-or-miss as some days we got more fresh towels than others (one day we had to call for some altogether). The bad: the cold water coming from the kitchen faucet made quite the noise when running, desk staff not always as helpful as one might hope. By far, however, our experience was much more positive than negative. Would recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Wonderful Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Minpro
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at Staybridge Suites for four nights in mid-June. The room was great. Just wished we had longer to stay and enjoy. Lots of room for a family of four. Beds and pillows were just right. Kitchenette in the room had everything that was needed and more for an efficiency you won't use in New Orleans. Oversize desk gave a great place to spread out work, which is rare in many hotels. The breakfast was out of this world. I had read about the great breakfast, but you have to experience it to understand. They also have a couple of socials each week and give free supper. We got in on hamburger/hotdog night and it was great too. Always more food than you can eat. Parking was the usual in New Orleans, although there is not a designated drop-off or place to get completely out of traffic. They supposedly have parking somewhere, but we were told it was full. We parked across the street, but it was hard to lug bags down cobblestone sidewalks. However the room and the food excused any inconvenience this caused. Within 10 to 15 block walking distance of Convention Center and across the street from Mothers, which seemed to be an institution (gauging by the lines). I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little Too Laid back and Understaffed”
Reviews.Author: flansolo
Reviews.Content: Staybridge Suites is an excellent example of New Orleans' laid back attitude. Almost a little too laid back. We arrived in the middle of the Essence Festival in July. Check in is at 4:00, which we did not know when my weary party arrived at the Suites. We were told that many guests had requested a late checkout and our room was not ready yet. We stowed our bags and navigated the vicinity for an hour or so before returning and waiting another 2 hours for a room. We finally begged the sole staffer at the front desk, which was now overrun by restless guests, to give us a room. Luckily she did, although she claimed (rather unconcerned but polite) that there were many other guests who had been waiting longer than us. Maybe it's my 'big city' attitude but where I'm from, if you know there is an event in town with large crowds of people you overstaff. They seemed to have the same skeleton crew for the weekend that they have during hurricane season. Why are you out of towels at 11pm at night when a majority of the guests had checked out the previous afternoon? Why does this not concern you?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Ronbokaz
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location very close to the casino and a reasonable walk to the French Quarter and Riverwalk areas. Rooms are larger than a standard hotel and offer the benefit of a full kitchen. Rates were very reasonable compared to other hotels in the general area. For parking, the hotel lot was full but directly across the main entrance on Tchoupitoulas Street is a public lot that is very convenient and a couple dollars cheaper; I'd recommend self parking there and it's a short walk across the street to check in. Pool is not large but similar to many of the other hotels in the area but the water temp was comfortable to feel refreshing after a day in the heat. Overall a good choice for a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good for families”
Reviews.Author: NewOrleansMmik
Reviews.Content: I live in New Orleans and we decided to stay at the Staybridge for one night. This place is in a great location to go to the Warehouse district for great restaurants and a couple of night clubs and then close enough to the French Quarter for Bourbon street and Flea Market. You are also very close to the Casino and Canal Place shopping and Riverwalk shopping. The hotel is not very upscale but if you are not looking for anything fancy this is a great place to stay. The room had a queen bed, pull out sofabed, full size refrigerator, stove, microwave, dishwasher, and kitchen amenities. They also serve a free continental breakfast which was pretty good. If you are trying to stay close to everything and not have to eat out for every meal this would be great if you are on a budget. There is a Rouses grocery store in the French quarter also one near the Superdome. Since we only stayed one night we didn't have much contact with the staff and didn't utilize the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Dockerydock
Reviews.Content: During our family reunion stay, the hotel made a withdraw from my credit card two weeks prior to my arrival, calling it a deposit. This "deposit" was not mentioned during the booking. Parking was $33 a day separate from room billing. Our rooms were not cleaned daily and no instructions on room cleaning requests were given. We requested towels after not receiving room cleaning, we never received them. Upon departure, my final bill did not reflect the early "deposit" the hotel made and the ink ran out while printing leaving the clerk with writing in totals.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: Jeevis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close enough to walk to the French Quarter and far enough that you can enjoy a quiet evening too. The rooms were well appointed and four of us comfortably shared a 2-bedroom suite with kitchenette. On certain days, the hotel observes "Happy Hour" and free wine, beer, and food is served in the dining area. Breakfast was also excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sagray1231
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location, free breakfast free dinner 3 nights a week!! Kitchenette in all of the rooms! Very convenient to Bourbon Street, and the French Quarter! Bridget Evans is amazing, she works the sundown receptions at night....make sure you say hi when you are here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tetrisz54
Reviews.Content: Rey nice hotel. The room was very large with a full kitchenette. It was quite and secure. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cityguy3
Reviews.Content: The Staybridge is in a great location, easy walking distance to everything but far enough out of the hustle and bustle that you don't hear lots of street noise all night. The room was great and the staff was very friendly. Breakfast was a nice touch to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel, just off the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: jrquinn57
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice business hotel. Close enough to the Convention Center to walk, close enough to the French Quarter to walk, and therefore you can eat anything you want with all the walking! Hotel was clean, staff very friendly, and it's easy to get to. Parking (like everything else in NO) was somewhat expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Staybridge New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: JordansofWeiss
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best places we have stayed at. Check-in was upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite. Traveled with parents so the extra room was great. Breakfast each morning was wonderful with over 30 items to choose from and did I mention it was free. Our suite had a full kitchen but who wants to cook when you are staying this close to the French Quarter and the Riverwalk. Will definitely come back. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “great spot”
Reviews.Author: Mappergal
Reviews.Content: we loved the location and the large room. We had booked through Expedia and got a very good deal on hotel and flight. it was great for 4 fiftyish ladies on an adventure. the free breakfast is fantastic with lots of variety and lots of fresh fruit. we look advantage of the free supper twice and it was great. We had a little trouble keeping enough towels in the room - but it worked out. I will be looking to see if there is a Staybridge in the city we chose for next years get away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, space and value”
Reviews.Author: jborozco
Reviews.Content: Great value for the rooms. We went for a bachelor party, had 2 rooms reserved. When we got there, they had us on 2 totally different floors. We asked to be put closer, the guy apologized, got us 2 rooms right next door and gave us a 6-pack of beer for it. The rooms were spacious, kitchenettes, pull out couches and flat screen TV's. Walking distance to everything! Bourbon st, French quarter, Harrah's is right across the street too. We paid $200/night

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: tombillinge
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and, although we had a big room (for 4 people), we did not get good value for money. Our room was a suite and had a kitchen, but we did not need it (we were given no choice when booking). The beds were OK - not as comfortable as they should be. Breakfast was not good - it was a very limited buffet with some scrambled eggs, ham and bread,old fruit, tea and coffee. I have had way better breakfasts in small hostels and guesthouses. The location was good, walking distance to the French Quarter. They have free wifi, but the real kicker is that they charge $30 for parking - the same as the parking lot across the street. After many additional taxes, the total cost was very high. For the price you could stay in the W or Hyatt. If you are going to spend a lot of money - go to one of those instead, they are very close.

Reviews.Title: “Handy Location”
Reviews.Author: Mikeycee
Reviews.Content: We booked Staybridge Suites in New Orleans for a post cruise stay in New Orleans during the week of March 10-13. At the time of the booking we were thinking of the very positive experience we had staying at Staybridge Suites in Albuquerque, New Mexico. We assume the Staybridge in New Orleans is a "makeover" of a previous hotel. It was nice, the room was large and did have kitchenette. Though we were on the top floor we had no real view except of other buildings in the area. There is a pool but the weather was too cool to have had a chance to use and there was no jacuzzi. Breakfast was passable similar in quality and choice to a Holiday Inn Express. We had experienced there evening social at the one in Albuquerque but unfortunately this particular Staybridge only offered it Tu-Th. The good news was we were within walking distance of the French Quarter and most of the popular attractions(especially the restaurants)of New Orleans. We also took advantage of the trolley which goes along the river and up Canal street. You can buy a day or 3 day pass. The day pass we purchased for $3 ea. was helpful in getting around but wouldn't be especially useful if you were pressed for time or if it had been very humid/hot. I don't believe the trolleys are equipped with air conditioning, just a fan where the conductor sits.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - walk to French Quarter & Cruise Terminal”
Reviews.Author: escape5
Reviews.Content: I can't remember desk staff at a hotel that were more genuinely pleasant and helpful. They truly made us feel like welcomed guests. It was a short cab ride from the Amtrak station to the hotel. While we were in New Orleans we walked to the French Quarter, Riverwalk and the Harrah's Casino. At the end of our stay there we walked six blocks to the Julia Street Cruise Terminal. It was an easy walk on a Sunday morning. (the street name is pronounced - chop i two' lis, it's American Indian) The room was clean and spacious. We had a view of Harrah's and the cruise ships when they were in port. The bed was comfortable. Breakfast was good with a nice variety. We made use of the bring-one/take-one book exchange. The ATM near the front door was secure and convenient. I would have liked one of those folding luggage racks for our suit cases.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Kaylab1
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with our stay at this hotel. It's a few blocks from the French Quarter, so you have fun within walking distance but not at the expense of noise and foot traffic. Parking was $30 a day but it is in a closed garage, which we appreciated, and there weren't a lot of other options. The staff was very friendly, even if they did recommend a restaurant to us that doesn't actually exist anymore. (We spent almost 30 minutes walking around trying to find it.) Downside: we got a 5:00 am wakeup call we didn't ask for. Upside: the staff apologized profusely and comp'd our parking. This is a good pick for hotels in New Orleans. It's definitely one of the better deals.

Reviews.Title: “Billing issue”
Reviews.Author: preetsingh8302
Reviews.Content: A+++ for location, place and staff. Failing grade as far as billing . My stay was pre-paid and almost 3 weeks later they charged my credit card for $189.00. Filed a dispute, hopefully they will reverse the charge. My advice, please keep an eye on your credit card statement for few months when you stay in this hotel. Seems like they wait for some time to charge your credit card so customer will not notice.

Reviews.Title: “Request service on the weekend.”
Reviews.Author: Erica Y
Reviews.Content: I've never stayed in a hotel and had to request for my bed to made up. We went out and return to the room at midnight and the bed was just like we left it UNMADE. We called the front desk and was informed that on weekends you must request services. Parking was 30 bucks plus tax a day. Next time I will take a cab to save mmoney on parking and will request service.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: djvh
Reviews.Content: A bland, but clean hotel in a decent location. If you are looking for interesting places to stay - this isn't the place.

Reviews.Title: “Typical positive Staybridge experience...”
Reviews.Author: wouldbeworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: Finishing last night at the Staybridge New Orleans. Location is very nice being in the downtown area, within walking distance of Canal Street/Bourbon Street, businesses of core downtown New Orleans and Riverwalk attractions. Also near Harrah's casino as you might be interested. There are a variety of other hotels nearby which help reinforce the area as tourist or traveler friendly. A nice touch, however, is it is just enough off the main craziness of Canal/Bourbon that you can rest easy when you wish to do so. Nothing exceptionally different about this Staybridge from others I've stayed but very comparable. Clean rooms with small kitchenette area for extended stay as needed, comfortable bathroom, modern flat-screen television. Offers the included breakfast and evening food/beverages. All in all well maintained. Bed was a bit firm for my personal tastes but not unbearable. Internet is available wirelessly or wired (cable provided). Wireless seemed more than a bit "wonky", but wired connection has had no problems. Parking is expensive at $30/night, but is in a secured garage and is in-and-out (though I personally just needed somewhere to leave the car as I walked everywhere I wanted to go). I know there is cheaper if you're willing to walk some, just a question if you want convenience or more dollars in your pocket. If in the NOLA area again, I would definitely consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Location and Room”
Reviews.Author: threemarlenas
Reviews.Content: During our stayed in New Orleans we stay at the Staybridge Suites because we had read it was in a great location and it was equipped with a small kitchen. We were not disappointed at all, we got what we needed and more. We moved around the area without having to look for parking (we paid 30$ in the hotel). The service was great (thanks emika for the hospitality) and the breakfast was hot and included most of what our family of five might like to eat. Overall, I would recommend this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kkoz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of days on business. First, the location was only a couple of blocks from Canal and Bourbon Street, very close to the action in the quarter. It was also very close to the convention center, as well as the riverfront. I was able to walk to anything nearby. Additionally, I was able to get a room on a high floor on the end, looking directly out to the river - a wonderful view. The room was arranged a bit strangely, and it wasn't easy to work at the desk or sit on the couch to watch TV. However, that could just be the way the rooms on the end were arranged, and sacrifice that for the view. There was a small tear in the comforter, which was a bit of a turn off, but I've learned not to trust them, making it the first thing I usually tear off the bed and set aside. The wifi and wired internet connections were a bit tricky (they do change the access code every day), but I was eventually able to get logged on. The room rate was very reasonable, around $100/night, great for the location. However, the parking fee was nearly a third of the room rate, at $30/night. The breakfast in the morning wasn't too bad - fruits, a couple of warmers with the typical dehydrated hotel eggs, bacon or sausage. Overall, the hotel was clean, and my limited interactions with the staff were friendly. However, the location is what makes this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not typical of StayBridge”
Reviews.Author: Christopher M
Reviews.Content: I travel a LOT for business and stay in other hotels and StayBridges all over. First, I have to say that the location is fantastic. We could walk to everything: Bourbon St, touristy stuff, and the Convention Center. Second, the overall rooms are quite nice. Clean, large, not too out of date. Unfortunately, there are a couple of things that really put us off: 1) The internet, both wired and wireless, was not usable. The wireless couldn't get a connection with 2 laptops, 1 tablet, or an Android phone. The wired was so slow it was useless. 2) One room in our group was longer than a week, so the housekeeping was the "light touch", as expected. I did not expect this to mean so light that they didn't take out the garbage or replenish the toilet paper. Even when we called down to the front desk, nothing was done. We had to take the overflowing garbage down to the front desk and pickup the toilet paper. Not good.

Reviews.Title: “Our First trip to New Orleans !”
Reviews.Author: Lisa M
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to say, that we stayed almost 2 weeks. My husband was there for business, I was there for a vacation ! :) We could walk anywhere. The room was fantastic, Small kitchen, refrigerator, sink, microwave. Ironing board, iron, washer and dryer was complimentary. All we had to do was buy the detergent. The little market in the hotel, was open 24 hours. The food was very good. The 3 nights of supper, was very good ! We would stay here again, hands down. The rooms were VERY clean. and the maids were very courteous !

Reviews.Title: “What a city and what a great hotel !!!!”
Reviews.Author: jafo7153
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to New Orelenas for the first time for three nights and four day. First let me start off by saying we needed way more time. The staybridge is located in a perfect location close to the riverfront and close to the trolley line and close to Harrahs Casino. Emeralds resturant is about 4 blocks down. Mothers resturant across the street I didn't think the food was that great and kind of pricey for what you got. So location is perfect and bring some good walking shoes becuase your going to need them. Only used a cab twice once from the airport and once back to the airport. You can walk every where even to the French Quarter!! Our reservation was for a single room but when we got their they upgraded us to a two room suite !!! The staff is great and very helpful it most be thaT whole southern thing. We had ate breakfeast their every am they had ceral and eggs begal toast and fruit. We went to the pool one afternoon it's small but it did the trick. The beds where great and the rooms very clean and well taken care of. We are going back in March for a longer stay. One other side note pay 5 bucks and ride the trolley add day you get to see the city and it's just a great experience it's worth the 5 bucks and the time! One last thing go to the French Quarter Police Department and buy a shirt they sell them to support their police orgzation. You buy the shirts out of a vending machien they run between $15-20 buys. it's a neat suvenior and your also helping them out to. I want to send a shout out to the New Orleans PD great bunch of folks and to the trolley driver that also acted as our unoffical tour guide gave us more oral history about the city and trolley's they use then any book or museum .

Reviews.Title: “Not the best but far from the worst”
Reviews.Author: Barbara28970
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice; once for one month while on business, and again in August for six days, also on business. There were a lot of advantages to this hotel. I had one large room with two queen beds and a kitchen. The kitchen was a plus: dishwasher, full refrigerator, microwave, two-burner stove top, cabinets with dishes, pots and pans and utensils. However, the television was outdated, the carpeting had seen better days, and the sofa was small, not very comfortable, and probably should have been replaced. Bathroom and closets were fine. I did have some issues with the toilet and then the television and when I reported the problems, it took a while to be resolved due to an apparent disconnect with the front desk. There was also a mix-up with the room cleaning schedule and my sheets were not changed on time. I had to ask three times before it was handled. I have a feeling that this is not the norm for this hotel, but I did have issues with the service. The laundry room (I think there are two rooms with two washers and two dryers) are complementary, which is nice, however, I experienced problems several times with at least one of the appliances. The gym is very small. A weight set, two tread mills and a ellipitical. Location was not bad. It is situated close to the art galleries (warehouse district) as well as to the French Quarter, but not too close, so it was probably quieter than places in the quarter. My second stay was much better than the first visit and I did not have any issues. Would stay again while on business, but probably not for a vacation trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay In Nola”
Reviews.Author: crwchief6
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in october with my wife and child. I did use my priority club points for the stay but I did pay for parking as you normally do in NO. First arrived and parked on street to unload. Passing vehicles blow horn if you dont get out of street however. Checked in early and my room was not ready so got upgraded to king suite. I had a king studio reserved. Got to room and it had a queen bed but they quickly fixed that and I moved to another room down the hall. Parking can be a bit of a nightmare if you own a large vehicle as I do. You have to drive around the block and use your room key to open the gate then drive up a steep incline. The parking is also used by the condo owners so no parking in certain areas. You basically have 6 spots to chose from if you have a large vehicle. Three in the front as you drive in or drive through the covered area to reach the other outside 3 spots. Thank goodness no one else was parking there because my vehicle took up two spots. It is really cramped. You then take elevator in condo to first floor and walk through a locked gate to the hotel entrance. Room was nice. Liked the full size kitchen, sitting area and bedroom. Plenty of space. No noise. Breakfast was awesome. Waffles, eggs, cereal, oatmeal, sausage, ham etc.. I could go own but it is plenty to fill you up. Sitting area in lobby was nice for my son to play around and watch tv and play board games. Location was great. We walked to everything except the zoo. Felt really safe. The mini-mart by the front desk was open 24 hours and they have just about anything you wanted. I will be staying here again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to my next stay”
Reviews.Author: KLB8687
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at the Staybridge! We had no problems at all & I would definitely stay here again. We stayed in a one bedroom suite on the 14th floor & the room was so much better than a normal room. First of all we had our own mini kitchen & bar area with the living room off of that, then you could open the double doors into the separate bedroom & bathroom area. It was the perfect area to get ready for a night out in Nola while others can sip cocktails in the living room. We got a smoking room which was really convenient, most hotels don't offer smoking rooms anymore. The windows were floor to ceiling so we left them open for a great view of the city- and our parking lot- my husband loves being able to see where our car is parked. Parking was standard, we didnt use valet for $35/night, ended up parking across the street for $28/night. More about the room: everything was spotless, bed was comfortable, lotions, soaps, coffee, tea, popcorn was provided, only weird thing was we didn't have a bucket to catch ice from the icemaker so we used a bowl. No ice machines in the halls so make sure you turn on the icemaker right away because it takes a minute to get started. We were only here for one night & slept in so we didn't get to enjoy the free breakfast or pool or any other amenities, but the room definitely sold me on this hotel. We got a great last minute rate & I'm looking forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for both conference centre and French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: 1stglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Comfortable 2 bedroomed suite with separate living room and kitchen equipped with sofa, easy chair and dining table and 4 chairs. Free breakfast offering good choice of hot and cold, evening snacks provided on 3 nights we were there. Front desk were a bit laid back but then I guess that may be New Orleans in general. Problem with changed passwords for internet when we were not advised of the change and the reaction of the front desk was "well I guess we should have told you"....yes you should...it's what service is all about. Apparently it happens every week but they still do not think to advise the guests when it happens. 10/15 minute stroll to the Riverside, Convention Centre and French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean family hotel”
Reviews.Author: rcpow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for a family or business traveler staying in new orleans. It's quiet (for new orleans), but still close to plenty of attractions like the casino and the aquarium. For people looking to party in the french quarter, it's a little bit of a walk. There were many restaurants, shopping, and attractions within walking distance. This hotel was on par with other staybridge suites I have stayed in. It had very clean rooms, clean linens, comfortable beds and pillows, and a clean bathroom. The room was spacious and i had plenty of room to spread out my work stuff. Employees were very friendly and helpful. We stayed in a one bedroom suite and the kitchen was great, a fridge, two burner stove, with all the pots, pans, silverware, cups, etc needed to prepare meals right in the room. There is a little area by the front desk that sells frozen meals, drinks, wine/beer, snacks, toiletries, tylenol, and other travel necessities if you need something in a pinch. The free breakfast downstairs is above average as far as free breakfast goes. From Tuesday thru Thursday, Sundowner receptions in the afternoon with free food and drinks are a great amenity if you are staying mid-week. Business travelers getting per diem can really stretch their $ here. Tip: There are no icemakers in the hotel. Instead, each room has a fridge with an icemaker in it. Remember to flip the little lever in the freezer to turn the icemaker on as soon as you check in your room. Otherwise you will be waiting an hour for ice when you really need it! Although we were billed $30 for parking each night, it was in a covered garage adjacent to the hotel. I found outdoor parking for $28 across the street, but the savings wasn't worth it to me. After talking to several other people who stayed in nearby hotels, this seemed to be the going rate for overnight parking in new orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Oasis While in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: visitar
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides a perfect resting place while you explore New Orleans. Happy Hour means free beer and wine on certain nights in the lobby. Proximity to the Convention Center and the French Quarter means that you can exist here without needing to rent a car. If you choose to walk to most destinations, you'll also save parking fees, which can add up. Parking is available across the street; however, you 'll wind up paying between $30 and $40 a day for this privilege. The hotel is super clean and quiet. We used our in-room refrigerator and microwave daily. You can have breakfast in the dining room, and this includes a variety of eggs, sausage, fresh fruit, juices and other items. Consider taking an apple or banana up to your room for a late night snack! The hotel is surprisingly affordable when you compare it to neighboring properties. It is located right across the street from "Mother's" and you won't want to miss out on some authentic New Orleans cuisine there, including the baked ham. The surrounding streets are funky eclectic, and safe. You can easily walk to the World War II museum. If you have children who are picky, you'll find plenty of familiar foods in the Staybridge Pantry or you can walk a ways down the street to find a Subway or Wendy's. The French Market is an easy and pleasant walk. At no time during our stay did we have issues with safety. We were also able to book some tours that picked us up right in front of our hotel. The staff there is awesome - dedicated to making your stay pleasant and comfortable. They are friendly and accommodating. If you are traveling with family members, this is the way to go! There is also a small, outdoors swimming pool located off of the dining room. You will find this hotel to be a cool, pleasant respite while you get to know the city. When I head back to New Orleans, I'm staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but average rooms”
Reviews.Author: tjouett
Reviews.Content: Just went to New Orleans for 1 night. Decided to stay at this hotelbecause it was an excellent location. Right next to Harrah's casino and a 15 minute walk to the French Quarters. Although we had to pay $30 a day for parking, we figured we'd pay the same anywhere else in the city. The front desk personnel (Paul) was delightful. I suppose I was expecting more from a hotel apart of the priority club. The bed was stiff and hard, but after a full night of drinking on Bourbon St I didn't even notice when we were ready for bed.

Reviews.Title: “so so...bad management and bad housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: familytravelB
Reviews.Content: Not too impressed with our stay at this hotel. Management tried to change our rate prior to arrival despite our confirmed reservation. The option they gave me was to pay a rate that is $100 higher than the confirmed rate or face downgrading in room type. They tried to blame the issue with the rate to their Central Reservation office...when in fact the hotel failed to set a minimum length of stay on the special rate we were to received for the Rotary International Convention. I had to reached out to IHG Customer Care department to get the hotel to honoured the rate....and despite all that that they still tried to charge me $100 more per night at check-in. Location was good, front desk agent and Paul (the FD Supervisor/manager) were helpful. However, housekeeping is very poor. The suite was dirty, sticky kitchen floor, dirty and filthy carpet and during our 5 nights stay our carpet was never vacuumed. Definitely lack of attention and lack of pride in the housekeeping area.

Reviews.Title: “Untrustworthy... period”
Reviews.Author: kzyp
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from the International Rotary Convention in New Orleans. I had the opportunity to interact with Staybridge Suites for the first time in my life and it was a terrible experience. In fact Staybridge Suites outright failed the Rotary four-way test which is: 1. Is it the TRUTH? 2. Is it FAIR to all concerned? 3. Will it build GOODWILL and BETTER FRIENDSHIPS? 4. Will it be BENEFICIAL to all concerned? Mine is just one incident that I'm aware of and it goes like this: I booked my hotel in November 2010 for the May 2011 conference. I still have the confirmation in my inbox (66355521) at the special conference rate of $109.99. The night before our departure, I called to confirm our stay only to find out they cancel my reservation in April. When asked why, their response was, "Because we tried to charge your credit card last month and it was declined." Firstly, why would a hotel try to charge a client's credit card one month before the reservation. Secondly, of course my credit card was declined. The credit card I used in November 2010 expired in February 2011 so I have a new card with the same credit card number, but with a new expiry date. Pretty simple. When I asked them why they didn't call me, they told me they called my cell. I find this odd because I didn't receive a voice mail or text or anything. They never tried to email me either even though they successfully emailed my confirmation to me. Odd. This was only one incident of many within my group. Staybridge canceled another couple's room and increased the price for others. What clearly happened here is that Staybridge realized their $109.99 price was too low after they discovered there were Rotarians coming in from all over the world so they increased prices and canceled people's rooms so they could sell them at a much higher rate. I'd like to know if Staybridge has any Rotarians on staff in their senior management team. I stayed at the Sheraton and thoroughly enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “No problems - only good times”
Reviews.Author: CelticTravellers
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant as I was reading some of the reviews, worried that we might arrive to no room. I called the week before and confirmed everything was okay. We arrived and could not have been greeted by a friendlier person - Erika on the front desk was wonderful. Every day that she was there she always said hello and was curious as to what we were doing and if we were having a good time. The room was clean, and a great size. We could not have asked for better housekeeping, each day when we got back to the room everything was taken care of. The breakfast was more than sufficient, with so many choices, well stocked and friendly staff. We took advantage of 3 Sundowners and were very surprised with the meals, from Pulled Pork sandwiches, to a great BBQ and even Roast Beef one night. Our check out also went smoothly, we have nothing but great comments. This was our first time staying in a Staybridge, but it won't be our last.

Reviews.Title: “Do not trust your reservation.”
Reviews.Author: JanuaryPie
Reviews.Content: Three days before our reservation I received a letter in the mail that my reservation could not be honored and I was bumped to a lesser hotel multiple blocks away. I made the reservation 8 months ago due to this being a Jazz Fest weekend and hotels can be VERY hard to find. Called and emailed the General Manager who sent the letter. NO RESPONSE. Spoke with Customer Service and Guest Relations and was offered nothing more than standard policy of this lesser booking posted on their website. Proceed with caution. They will overbook and pick the higher rates over you. I have stayed at this hotel several other times and this was my New Orleans choice but i will never stay there again. You should not either unless you want to zero faith in your reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, convenient understated quality”
Reviews.Author: kumtux
Reviews.Content: Attended a large national conference in New Orleans with the two anchor hotels for the conference being the Marriott and the Sheraton on Canal Street. The Staybridge is four blocks away in the central business district, so it is quiet with convenient access to "Mothers" and the Casino. Great breakfasts and weekday receptions with drinks and light dinners. Very clean and friendly with reasonable rates. Efficiency rooms that are great for extended stays. Also within an easy walk of the Convention Center. I was not disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Never got to stay as they cancelled me before I arrived!”
Reviews.Author: InsideNumbers
Reviews.Content: Have stayed there twice. Like it. Excellent location. But I received a letter (!) from them on the Monday before the Thursday I was to check in telling me they had booked me into the Residence Inn on St. Joseph St. 6 blocks farther away from the French quarter. Our friends had booked the hotel next door so we could be near after they tried and got shut out at the Staybridge. Called the hotel and she said they had overbooked by 25 parties arriving on that date. Made the reservation 1/8/11 for a 4/28/11 arrival. At least they told me ahead of time unlike one of the other reviewers. Maybe management has changed? Comping my first night at the Residence Inn though.

Reviews.Title: “Never got to stay - arrived Friday before Mardi Gras to be told room cancelled”
Reviews.Author: ScotlivinUSA
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay in this hotel in July 2010 for Mardi Gras. Arrived at hotel on March 4 to be told they had no rooms and that we had to stay at a Marriott. The Marriott was really good. Really disappointed that a hotel could cancel your room for Mardi Gras without telling us.....

Reviews.Title: “Staybridge canceled a guaranteed room during Mardi Gras on us!”
Reviews.Author: Cassie27889
Reviews.Content: Last August we paid for a week vacation during Mardi Gras at the New Orleans Staybridge Suites. They called on February 18th and told us they gave our room to a group who just decided to extend their stay another week. The person who did it hasn't returned our calls!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value, look no farther”
Reviews.Author: kspitoh
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the money! Not much more than others and you get so much more! Clean room, comfy bed, good sized room, and great free breakfast. Don't miss the free light dinner and drinks offered a few times during the week. Will look for a Staybridge next time I need a hotel. You will not be disappointed. Also, check out the street car 2 blocks away, pay five dollars to ride all day--cheaper than a cab!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and good location.”
Reviews.Author: Travel4pleasure07
Reviews.Content: Compared to the Hilton and Harrahs this place doesnâ€™t looks like much. That being said I cannot say a lot of bad things about our 8 night stay. We got our room for $99 a night when most places in New Orleans are at least double per night. I don't know if there was a mix-up by the two of us got a large suite with two separate bedroom/ bathrooms off one living room. This would have been great for a family and was a lot of room for two people. The rooms were clean and had plenty of room and closet space. Our room was nice and quiet. The hotel is in a location where it is easy to walk anywhere. The trolley was also nice to utilize if you want to go down to the French Market or up Canal St. There were certain aspects that made my stay here very enjoyable. First would be the daily breakfast buffet. They had a good variety for a free continental breakfast and lots of hot coffee. There were also two or three nights a week when they offered free dinner, which wasnâ€™t great but I ate it and I am fairly particular. Itâ€™s a free mealâ€¦ in New Orleans, Iâ€™ll take it. What made this so nice was the ladies that were refilling the food, especially at dinner. They were so sweet and even came around and picked up our plates for us. It was just perfect to get up, eat breakfast, and take a cup of coffee to go explore this beautiful historic city. Only downside of our stay was the fact that you pretty much have to ask them to clean your room. They didnâ€™t come in to replace towels when we were out. If you are clean then it is not a big deal, they brought towels right up when we asked for them. Also the service at the front desk wasnâ€™t the best, it seemed like they had other things to do. By far the value and good things outweighed the negative. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value option near casino and Superdome”
Reviews.Author: ramolnar
Reviews.Content: Looking at options in New Orleans over Labor Day weekend, I booked this hotel because of its good value, about $100 per night. I was very pleasantly surprised. First, let me get the minor negatives out of the way. Free parking is tricky; I wound up on the street 1.5 blocks away. You might just want to pay. And check-in service was slow, though check-out was fine. Also, this hotel is near Mother's eatery, the casino, and Superdome, so if you're trying to stumble back after a night at the French quarter, it's a long stumble. That said, there are a lot of excellent things about this hotel. Room quality is high, including the beds and heating units. Even though I was on the street side, the room was quiet. Internet is free. The suite concept includes fridge, burners, and microwave. There's provided popcorn. There's morning breakfast, which has better than average variety for a free offering. I have no hesitation recommending this place as a basis for all of New Orleans, not just the party places. It also was a good first experience with the brand.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable prices, nice facilities and location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: mnilu
Reviews.Content: First of all, we miss the first night due to our flight connections from Chicago, and at the end we did not have to pay it, even if it was not the hotel's fault. Nice two- bed "room" (it looked like an apartment, maybe because we europeans are not used to this big-thing in the USA), anaywa, confortable, silent and nice service. Breakfast for free in the morning was a big extra and made things easier. Besides, and just in case you want to have dinner or so, there is kitchen available in the "apartment". Prices were good, I mean about 400 euros 6 nights for the both of us was excellent and at that level of hotel, very difficult to find in Europe, I guess. besides, nice location and (in general) staff. Worth the visit!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better! Great Location and excellent prices!”
Reviews.Author: girl3383
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to New Orleans for our one year wedding anniversary and I searched for hotels for a few weeks. We finally settled on this one because it was in a great location and the price was excellent! I was initially very leary because the price was so good that I thought it had to be just a decent place to sleep. We were very pleased that it exceeded our expectations! The hotel staff was friendly and the hotel was clean! The breakfast was perfect and the outdoor pool was very nice! We enjoyed our stay so much and we will definetly stay there again when we travel to New Orleans again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: mare723
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from July 15 through the 19th. We arrived and parked across the street at a pay lot since parking at the hotels garage was full. Not a problem, parking is a premium down there. We found the staff to be very pleasant and quick to respond to any problems. We had a ring from the sprinkler on the ceiling near the TV/armoir fall on the floor at some point in the night. I took the thing to the lobby and the manager called maintenance. They had it fixed promptly. The breakfast was nice and they have mini happy hours during Tuesday through Thursday. Our room had a nice size fridge and a view of Poydras Street and Mother's Restaurant. That way I can keep an eye on the line at the restaurant and see when it was short enough to go across the street to Mothers. They do have a small pool, we didn't use it, but the little kids seemed to enjoy it very much! Since my husband had to work while we were there, I had the day to sightsee and was very glad we were near the French Quarter. I was able to walk to all the sights that I was interested in. I was alone during the day and never felt unsafe during my time there. In the evening my husband and I would go out to dinner and came back to the hotel around 10pm. Again we never felt like we were in a bad or unsafe area. On the 18th, I used the laundry area, since we were on the 18th floor, we used the laundry area on the 16th floor--they also have washer/dryers on 2 other floors. The use of the washer and dryers is free, they do sell detergent and softeners in the lobby at their mini-market. We normally travel with the Purex sheets that have detergent, softener and dryer sheet in one, made it very convenient to do the laundry. My only complaint would be that the laundry room on the 16th floor doesn't circulate air very well, so if both dryers are running, it's a sauna in there. The bed in the room was very comfortable, the couch was large enough for us to sit and plan our evenings, and the free WiFi was nice. The only odd thing was where the TV was located, yeah you could pull it out and angle it towards the bed or the couch, but really, we didn't mind. The noise level outside wasn't bad till a group of young adults (there was a HUGE church convention with young adults from various states in town) seemed to mob the area and the cops had to use their sirens to keep them moving and not block the intersection. Honestly, it wasn't bad, but know when there are large conventions in town, you might hear more street noise than normal.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with teenagers”
Reviews.Author: aubiegirl
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in New Orleans because I was traveling with 2 teenage boys and I needed a suite. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite. The suite was very clean and the accommodations were perfect. Each bedroom had 2 double beds so the teens each had his own bed. The front desk staff was extremely nice and willing to assist us in any way that we asked. This hotel is an extended stay hotel so it does not routinely offer housekeeping on the weekends, but when you ask for service the rooms will be serviced. We asked for ours to be cleaned and it was.

Reviews.Title: “Really excellent conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: IanSheffield
Reviews.Content: The hotel exceeded expectations, and I'd really recommend it, particularly for visiting the conference centre. Free wifi, a good complimentary breakfast, great location within walking distance of the main conference centre, and near the tourist areas of the French Quarter. Friendly and helpful staff. Exceeded expectations significantly, and recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Made My Family Feel Unsafe& A Filthy Hotel For Even My Pets To Stay”
Reviews.Author: StaybridgeStinks
Reviews.Content: We stayed@the Staybridge from November 5th to the 8th 2009 for my daughter's wedding and the room was never clean or replenished with towels. We had to go to the front desk to ask if they were going to service our room and they told us yes but it never happened. Several times durning our stay we had to ask for towels. There was a homeless man sleeping on the bench by the entrance to the hotel at night and was still there in the morning. There was also unsavory people hanging around the front desk@night visiting the employee on duty you could tell they weren't staying @ that hotel.People by the elevators that didn't belong@that hotel asking for handouts. No safe in the room so when asked if I could keep my valuables in the front desk safe they told me it was not available now and they didn't know when it would be available so when packing to check out a necklace was left in the drawer of the nightstand and a few hours later called back to the hotel the front desk told me no one has checked in to that room the only person that has been in that room was the cleaning lady and they couldn't find my necklace. I had them investigate but they told me that they have never had any complaints of this matter on this hotel so they don't feel like that their staff did anything wrong. It was white gold with diamonds and the lady told me that even if it was platinum they weren't have taken it . I know I forgot the necklace but if she believes that her employee didn't take it I have a levee I want to sell her. I wouldn't have gone to New Orleans but that is where my daughter wanted to get married The carpet in the room was sticky and dirty made my white socks turn black. When we were walking in the hotel from the front desk to our room we didn't feel safe at all.You had to park across the street in a open parking lot and pay approx $40.00 a day what a Rip Off. I will never stay in another Staybridge or it goes without saying never step foot in New Orleans again. After Katrina that city hasn't even tried to fix their city back to even where it was before they are waiting for a handout from Everybody Else. I really shouldn't be Surprised it is a Very Unsafe City and Unsavory Town. I can see why they call it the Big Easy because people are lazy and laid back and in no hurry to do anything and they are so used to living in that filth that they don't know any better. This is the Worst City I have ever stayed in and the Filthest Staybridge.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience, Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: napoleon622
Reviews.Content: I made my travel and hotel arrangements for a recent conference late and ended up getting closed out of a lot of the official conference hotels. Thus began a whirlwind search to find suitable accommodation for the four days I was going to be in the Big Easy, no easy feat given that Jazz Fest was also taking place during the course of my visit. My main criteria in choosing a hotel was location as I needed to be reasonably close to the Convention Center. Safety, price, and comfort also factored into my decision. After reading a number of reviews of area hotels, some of which were down right scary, I settled on Staybridge Suites. I was not disappointed. The hotel is located on the fine line that exists between the French Quarter and the Warehouse District. It's an easy ten minute walk to get to the Convention Center. Yes, it's slightly further than the Hilton or one of the other hotels on Convention Center Boulevard, but I really didn't find this to be a problem. Actually, watching all of the conventioneers stream out of the Hilton every morning reminded me of a cattle call. I was glad to have a little more breathing room. My suite, a standard studio consisting of two beds, bathroom, couch, and kitchen (refrigerator, microwave, sink, dishwasher, electric burners) was on the 2nd Floor of the hotel facing Poydras Street. I initially thought the street noise, and the proximity to the elevator, was going to be a problem but this ended up not being an issue. The room itself was comfortable and fairly spacious. It was probably more than I really needed, but it was nice to spread out and have the option of staying in and whipping something up as opposed to going out for dinner all the time. You definitely get your money's worth where the amenities are concerned. The WiFi access is free and there is no additional charge to use the fitness room or the pool. Best of all, there is a breakfast buffet with hot AND cold selections every morning. I absolutely loved this as I need a good breakfast to give me a jump start in the morning and you can't always rely on continental breakfast being provided at a convention. I always left for the day feeling well fed and was able to take fruit and/ or yogurt with me for later on in the day. The hotel also offers food (tacos, BBQ, etc.) on certain nights (currently Tues. thru Thurs.) as part of their Sunset Receptions. I never went to any of these, but it was nice to have the option. The hotel does not have a dedicated restaurant. As far as area dinning is concerned, I recommend U.S. Prime, a nice little place just a few feet down the street from the hotel, Gordon-Biersch (on Poydras Street close to Convention Center Boulevard), and either Poppy's Time Out or the Crazy Lobster at Riverwalk. Mother's is also right across the street from the hotel, but I didn't go there. The hotel doesn't have it's own dedicated airport shuttle, but Airport Shuttle, Inc. picks up and drops off at the downtown hotels. I HIGHLY recommend this as an alternative to a taxi to and from the airport as the cab fare is expensive. My colleague paid $42 (in cash -- credit cards weren't accepted) for her trip from the airport to the Hilton. The airport shuttle is $38 round trip. You can buy your ticket for the shuttle at the airport near Baggage Claim. The transportation was definitely reliable -- I was picked up at the hotel at the time stated on my return ticket. I am extremely satisfied with my experience at Staybridge Suites. The location was perfect and I felt safe and comfortable. Also, I think the staff made a concerted effort to make sure that guests had a good experience. In an industry where guests are typically charged through the nose for service and convenience I really feel this hotel outdoes itself an many levels.

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Anjiggy
Reviews.Content: this hotel was very clean, had free breakfast every day, and the rooms were like a studio apartment! shower flow was good, bed and pillows were comfy & clean. free WiFi was a plus! You feel safe here, and staff was friendlly too. location was within walking distance of harrah's casino, french quarter, and convention center!

Reviews.Title: “Overall great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: pammommy
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVED staying at this hotel! It was close to just about everything. The French Quarter, Riverwalk Mall, the Superdome, Harrah's Casino, and the Aquarium of the Americas were within walking distance. Mother's Restaurant (supposed to be really good, but I didn't visit) is right across Tchopitoulas street. The Louisiana Children's Museum is a few blocks away but still relatively close to walk to, and so worth the trip! There is also a Wal-Mart nearby (<10 minutes' driving time), which is always a big help for me. The airport is about 30 minutes away. I came to this hotel to visit extended family in the area, and the hotel is about 5 minutes off the highway. Super clean, the reception desk staff was quite friendly, and the hotel had a quick-stop shop to buy snacks and toiletries. Great breakfast and light evening fare some nights. Comfortable, spacious rooms with clean kitchen area and full-size refrigerator. We happened to stay during the Essence Festival and the hotel really only seemed crowded at breakfast time. Super-small swimming pool (didn't use it, though). Room service was a bit sluggish from day to day; often they couldn't come up until early afternoon (during naptime) or 4-5:00 in the evening. Parking is free but HORRENDOUS!! There is an underground lot housing about 15 cars, then two levels above housing about 6 cars each. Spots were extremely narrow and we squeezed our SUV in each time. All parking is access-key controlled with your room card. There's no place to really park while you're checking in or loading/unloading bags. I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Not trust worthy”
Reviews.Author: lea593
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got a group together to go the 2009 essence music festival with a group out of Atlanta. We were all booked to stay at the Staybridge suites in downtown new orleans. However, it was discovered, the day before our departure, that our rooms were given away. The hotel did help find other rooms, but instead of being right downtown with the action, we were five miles away and had to pay for taxis the entire weekend. The hotel tried to rectify their mistake by giving everyone a complimentary night stay at a future date of their choice. However, everytime we've tried to call and use our complimentary night, we either don't get a return call or they tell us that we can't use it on that day because they have a big event in town. DON'T TRUST THIS HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice to be near everything”
Reviews.Author: traveladvice9
Reviews.Content: We would definetly stay here again if we were to visit New Orleans. Clean hotel, outdoor pool, no jacuzzi, business center with 4 computers, convenient for printing boarding passes and checking out emails. Friendly staff, held our luggage, because we arrived too early for check in. Free coffee all day, free breakfast, with sausage, bacon on other days, scrambled eggs and hard boiled eggs, oatmeal and toppings, cottage cheese, nutrigrain bars, yogurt, grits, fresh fruit, muffins, pound cake, bagels, bread, english muffins, microwave, toaster, and waffle maker, chocolate milk, juices daily for breakfast. To go paper bags available to on the run. Popcorn in the afternoon one day, light dinner from Tuesday to Thursday. We had beef stew, chips, salsa, salad, beer, wine, soda, etc. one night, the other night was BBQ. We loved the hotel, we loved our room, it gets serviced only if you stay more than a week, otherwise, you get your bed made, not changed, extra towels, some days, and soap and shampoo only if you ask the maids, if they see you have leftovers in your shower you don't get extra. Hotel is next to Harrah's Casino and across the street from Mother's. We had their Ferdi special, was not impressed. Tasteless, our Thanksgiving ham was better tasting. Went to Harrah's for their $10 lunch, variety, had jambalaya, rice and beans, catfish, gumbo, fried chicken, plus all the other types of food typical of casino buffets. Walking distance to the French Quarter, Jackson Square, and all three Streetcars. Main streets to walk down to is Canal Street, this is the street where you can begin your walk all around the French Quarter. Three main streets you must walk down is Bourbon Street, especially at night, to hear Jazz spilling out of the bars. Try a Hurricane at Pat O'briens, they charge you $3 for the glass so take it home with you. Royal Street for antiques and quiet during the day, and Decatur Street will lead you straight to Jackson Square and Cafe du Monde. Decatur Street has a lot of the tourist type stuff to look at and buy. We bought the 5 day VisiTour pass for $20 at Unique Grocery on Bourbon Street, but probably only needed the 3 day pass for a 5 day stay. Most of your time will be spent walking around the areas close to the hotel. You probably could just get a day pass for $5 if you are planning to go to the Garden District and you can do a walking tour by yourself, just go to Frommer's online to get the walking tour information. Just pay the $1.25 fare each way and save yourself alot of money, instead of taking a tour with a tour company. Ate at Commander's Palace, spent around $130 with tips, since, I am from NY, I was not impressed, but by NOLA standards, decent. Strong Bloody Mary's there. We had an 11:30 Jazz Brunch reservation and did the 11/2 hour leisurely Garden District self - walking tour before that. Cemetary is closed on Sundays. Ate at Casemento's on Napolean and was the best and freshiest oysters a NYC person has ever ate, they have their own oyster leases, and the restaurant doesn't look like anything special, and portions are not big, but crab claws are also a must, get the large portion, our small portion left us wanting more. Take St.Charles(green)Street car to both of these restaurants. Angelo Brocato on the Canal Street Street car (red) was not impressive, and was rated #1 by tripadvisor, if you do not live in a big city, then go try their gelato and pastries, baba rum had artifical rum extract flavoring, not the real stuff. The Riverfront street car rides paralled to Decatur street up to the French Market, French Market had nothing impressive, one small fruit stand, the rest souveniers. Central Grocery was about the only thing we were impressed with. Brought three muffulettas from them, 1 we ate while in NOLA, and 2 to take back to NY uncut, just to impress our children with the shape and size of the sandwich. $14 for a sandwich that looked like a big hamburger to my little one, it is Italian cold cuts with a mixed olive salad spread. The olive salad, can get alittle overwhelming after awhile. Brought Pralines on Decature from Southern Candy Makers, still too sweet for us. If you like to walk, don't really need to buy VisiTour, but for us a day pass or 3 Day Visitour pass would be enough, next time we go back to NOLA, but not sure if we will go back, I think we covered everything we needed to see on this trip. We liked using our VisiTour pass because we could hop on hop off when it was late at night or when our feet started to hurt. Car is not recommended, expensive to park. Airport buhs for $2 each way was fine for us. Easy to catch E-2 airport bus to the French Quarter, give yourself 1 hour once you are on the bus to get to your hotel, and give yourself 2 hours from time of checkout from hotel to get to airport to go home. Get an E-2 bus schedule online or when you get on it from airport to hotel. Don't be afraid to ride with the locals, and save yourself $33 for 2 people for a taxi or airport shuttle, use that money for food and drinks. If time is a concern then take the taxi. Acme Oyster house, char-grilled oysters only, the fried stuff was way too salty and the batter was almost breadcrumb like. Casamentos is better for oysters on the half shell, crabclaws, and fried seafood nice, light, not greasy batter.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, hooked on Staybridge”
Reviews.Author: edenjordan
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location in a fabulous city, clean, nice to have fridge and microwave to make hot tea. Comfortable beds, wonderful staff. Made us feel welcome and at home. - I will seek out staybridge for my future travels....will be back to this property on my next getaway with my kids.

Reviews.Title: “Not "pet friendly"”
Reviews.Author: KariLex
Reviews.Content: The hotel claims to be "pet friendly" but if you have a dog, don't bother staying here. First of all there's a $75 non-refundable fee for just one night. There is no where for the pets to use the bathroom. I was told to take my dog into the median of Poydras Street (a very busy street) which is landcaped with bushes and ferns. There was no grass for several blocks of the hotel until you get to St. Charles park. I just don't understand how they call it pet friendly when the charge an arm and a leg for the pet to stay and there is no where for the pets to go. Save yourself headache and money by putting your dog up in an expensive kennel or staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awesome amenities”
Reviews.Author: aquila19
Reviews.Content: Staybridge is located about 20-30 minutes away from the airport via shuttle bus. It is a relatively new building (or so it seems from it's exterior) and is right across the street from Mother's Restaurant and two blocks away from Harrah's. We were a group of 9, and my room was 307, which looks right across the street to Mother's. We could see the lines building up every morning (and some mornings it was a little crazy). The rooms are a very good size, with a full-sized fridge, a small stove (two burners), microwave, sink, dishwasher and even dining/cookware. The two beds were not exactly twin size nor were they full size. I think they fit one comfortably and would be a little cramped if there were to be two full sized adults. There is a couch that pulls out into a sleeper, so the room could comfortably accomodate 3. The morning breakfast buffet is plenty and very surprising. There are juices, coffee, milk (chocolate and regular), plus sodas and iced teas. Make your own waffle station, breads, scrambled eggs and meat, plus fresh fruit, yogurt and dried cereals. You could also take it to go if you were in a hurry, or eat back in your room as the diningroom does fill up fast. There is a small swimming pool outside of the dining area that is really only good for kids. The location is awesome -- we were a 10 minute walk from Cafe du Monde (and we would know since we went there 3 times during the weekend!) There is a business center with 3 computers that you could print boarding passes off of. There is a 24hours small "pantry" store with frozen foods and lots of snacks and necessities at outrageous prices, but hey, you are paying for the convenience. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable, albeit on the slow side at times. The shuttle bus is $38 roundtrip if you pay on the spot; we paid $30 with Expedia. If you take a taxi, the set price works like this: $33 for up to 2 people, or $14/person if 3 or more. So it really works out to about the same with tips. Try Deanie's Seafood. SIMPLY DELICIOUS!!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: alee1228
Reviews.Content: Staybridge Suites is a wonderful place to stay. It's within walking distance to the French Quarters, Harrahs Casinos, Mothers Restaurant, the River Walk and many more. Staybridge Suites had breakfast buffet served every morning. It was wonderful making waffles during breakfast while my stay there. I'd stay here again over and over.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GetAwayFromBoston
Reviews.Content: Our room was plenty big enough for the two of us and very clean. I was pleasantly surprised by the food selection at the daily free breakfast. It was so great to save money on breakfast and thus spend more on local cuisine. I am a person of small portions so my leftovers from those giant poâ€™ boys and muffulettaâ€™s were stored in my fridge until I was ready to nuke them up for a midnight snack. An additional plus: we had an early check-in, but this may have been due to visiting NOLA during September and arriving on a Wednesday. The location is perfect, close enough to walk to the Quarter, but far enough away for peace and quiet. For the price we paid, this hotel was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Staybridge - Good Location and Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: nickya78
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group of female friends for 4 days over the Labor Day weekend. Our top priorities when researching hotels were a) location to French Quarter b) safety. I had read a few stories about tourist being mugged and was quite concerned about how safe a small group of female would be while walking around the city at night. However, I am happy to say we all felt very comfortable staying in the area. We walk everywhere (even at 4:00 am in the morning!) and always felt quite safe at all times. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms were perfect for our needs - not 5 star but clean, big and quiet. Very good bargain for your money. It is a short walk to the French Quarter (10-15 minutes to Bourbon Street at a leisurely pace). However, if you donâ€™t want to walk, the Riverfront Streetcar is very close. You can also pick up the St. Charles Streetcar on Canal St â€“ about 4 short blocks from the hotel. We had a fantastic time in New Orleans and at the hotel and I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price for the location...but....”
Reviews.Author: Juicy555
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is great for the price. The hotel is a 5-10 minute walk to the French Quarter and other points of interest (i.e. Harrahâ€™s Casino, Convention Center...), the hotel room was decent. The staff was average. Usually when you check-in the front desk staff informs you of the hotel amenities, such as the breakfast and the evening reception. The staff on duty did not say anything, the room number and the key were given and that's it. Also on the second day (Friday) the room was not cleaned, even though the housekeeping service should have been performed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, nice people”
Reviews.Author: kenko
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here the weekend of August 21 and had a wonderful time in NOLA. The Staybridge was in part a contributing factor in making our visit great. The staff was patient, helpful and always assisted us with taxi's, directions, and getting rooms together. The breakfast was good (great coffee) and alwyas filled. Close to the French Quarter, in a safe area and also near the trolley and Harrah's. I would recommend this hotel to others. The one negative was that there was no safe...oh well! But on the other had, it had a couple of computers so that we could print our boarding passes for our flight home.

Reviews.Title: “Homewood Suites is better”
Reviews.Author: jurypro
Reviews.Content: I travel for business to NO quite often for a week or so and usually stay at Homewood Suites. I thought for this 3 day trip I'd try a different suites hotel. The staff was very nice. The internet is terrible. Both the hot and cold taps in the kitchen were hot. My door stuck so badly I had to use two hands to open it and sometimes had to try 2 or 3 times. My bed was made only once. The "living room" was like a slightly wide hallway . The breakfast was okay, but not as good as Homewood. Their evening meal is not served on Monday. The parking is exorbitant so I parked across the street for $15 instead of $23. On the plus side, the bed and pillow were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull location/free meals/room”
Reviews.Author: Belgian-Brussels
Reviews.Content: Stayed there as a reward night (even got an upgrade and a welcome gift: snack, drink, fruit) - but even at the 120/150$ rate this is a BARGAIN. The hotel is not in the FQ, but clearly at safe walking distance, meaning you have the advantage of being close, without having the noise, odor, or the other limitations of a hotel in the FQ. Casino, CBD and some of the better restaurants are also within walking distance. The rooms are all suites (including canapÃ©, kitchenette with fridge, microwave, dishwasher etc), so it's really great if you're there for a few days. As I never stayed in a staybridge before, I was a bit surprised when they explained the "limited service" concept (just replacing towels and making up your bed) - but actually, if you're without children that's all that needs to be done. The limited service is more than compensated by the other offers of the hotel: the suites instead of rooms as I told before, there is a FREE laundry (actually there are 3 of them, on 5th, 10th and 15th floor or so), the free breakfast is great and includes fresh fruits and "make your own waffle" ... and last but not least, the "sundowner", actually free food and drinks on weekday evenings. Maybe NO offers some hotel experiences in special places that you do not find anywhere else, and the staybridge is quite "standard" but it is worth every $ you pay. Nice fitness, small pool, 4 PC business center with printers complete the overall image.

Reviews.Title: “location, location , location”
Reviews.Author: kerrylee57
Reviews.Content: Great location, without the noise and traffice of the French Quarter which is only a 5 minute walk. The rooms are spacious, with full kitchens,fridges and very clean as is the whole complex. The complimentary breakfast was great and varied each day. They also have complimentary dinner/wine/beer on Tues,Wed and Thurs nights.Laundry and Internet facilities are free.Lots of good food and restaraunts are close by.The only drawback is there not much outside area and the pool is quite small. It was also would be great if you could open your apartment windows for fresh air. This place is absolutely greatr value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Stay”
Reviews.Author: gourik
Reviews.Content: The hotel being an extended stay hotel has all the facilities you could ask for . They have a prompt room service and a very good view of the city from the room. All in all a nice place to be at...

Reviews.Title: “Great experience - location, breakfast, size of room”
Reviews.Author: meprg
Reviews.Content: In New Orleans for a conference that was held at the convention center and several hotels around town. Choose this hotel because it was located equal distance between convention center and french quarter. Very very nice experience. First of all, it had a great breakfast - and lots of tables for guests - better than I expected and quite helpful because I had such a busy schedule. The room was large, very quiet with two beds, couch, full kitchen. I did not need the kitchen because they served such a good breakfast but it was nice to know I had the option. It is a long walk to the convention center about 8 blocks but not uncomfortable. I was able to walk everywhere from the hotel - convention center, french quarter, riverwalk, aquarium, casino. It is also right across the street from Mothers restaurant - which came highly recommended but I could not fit it into my schedule. Small swimming pool ok for kids.

Reviews.Title: “The Trip that Never Was”
Reviews.Author: angrytravel
Reviews.Content: I reserved two nights at this hotel for the biggest weekend of Mardi Gras back in November. I went to check the reservation today and it says it was cancelled. (A day before the trip!) I called and they said it was because of my card...they couldn't process it, and I told them it was because of recent identity theft that they cancelled it and if I could use another card. Well if you know how Mardi Gras is, all of the rooms were sold out. Is it too much to ask for a common courtesy call? To ask if I still wanted the reservations or to see if I was indeed still planning on staying there????? Thanks for ruining my first ever Mardi Gras weekend. Will never ever make reservations or stay at this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: SNDRPRKR
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Staybridge Suites 31st Oct to 8th Nov with my husband. Check in was handled well and we got the rate we were given on booking. We had a studio room on the 4th floor near the lifts but it was quiet enough. Room was large with 2 queen beds a kitchen area with fridge freezer (had auromatic ice maker), microwave, a couple of electic rings and a coffee machine. More than satisfied with the room and fittings. Breakfast buffet was good, sundowner with beer and wine Tues - Thurs was an added bonus. Good location minutes walk from Canal street and Harrah's Casino. Handy for streetcars too. All in all an enjoyable stay, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for work”
Reviews.Author: MarkCWales
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel with small apartments -- studio, 1 or 2 bedrooms. The Studios can, my colleague, said be noisy because of noise from the hallways but my bedroom was very quiet, very comfortable and had lots of space. The kitchen was adequate and th working desk was good. The staff were great -- the General Manager offered to help carry my bags up to the room Lovely people who are clearly very committed. The one let down is the Internet access. Whether wired or wireless, it is slow and temperamental

Reviews.Title: “customer service in need of help”
Reviews.Author: vactionerNewOrleans
Reviews.Content: The rates at the Staybridge New Orleans was great. Unfortunately, they did not inform anyone there is a twenty-six dollar a night parking fee. This is not indicated online or when speaking to the hotel. I was shocked and realized it was not an oversight -several others checked in with me and was not pleased as well. The suites were roomy but in need of repairs. The notification of repairs did not appear to be an important issue. Each notification (there were several) took several hours to be addressed.
