I did like the location of the hotel, but will probably not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly Solid, No Frills, Business Hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Luck-o-the-Brirish
Reviews.Content: I am currently at the four week mark of an eight week stay at the Staybridge Inn New Orleans. To date my stay has been pleasant, while not exceptional for a fairly standard "business class" hotel. I have a king suite which is average to slightly above in size to that of comparable hotels. I have been pleased with the full breakfast served each morning as well as the "Sundowner" dinners served Tues. - Thurs. My only real complaint with this property would be with the housekeeping staff. After four weeks I'm still trying to figure out the cleaning schedule, and to be completely honest, I'm not wholly convinced there is one. Don't get me wrong, I wouldn't classify this hotel as "dirty". However the cleaning staff puts forth minimal effort at best. I actually had to leave a note in my room at one point that read "Please Vacumn". To top this off, one Sunday afternoon I happened to be in my room when the staff came through and the young lady actually stepped into my room and asked for a tip! Other than the previously stated "issues" I've been otherwise pleased with my stay here at the Staybridge. The location in great, within easy walking distance of all of New Orleans top attractions without the noise and raucousness of the French Quarter and Bourbon Street. I would recommend this hotel and will probably stay here again on return trips. Last thing I should note, this property has absolutely NO PARKING, so if you're driving plan on at least an additional $25.00 per day in your cost analysis.

Reviews.Title: “A Reasonable Place to Stay....”
Reviews.Author: GoldenSilence
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights at this hotel. My top priorities are a quiet room and a smoke-free room. For the most part, the hotel was quiet. The rooms are suites, which are generally quieter than standard rooms with connecting doors to the next guest's room. My only complaint on the quiet front was the doors from hallway into the rooms. They SLAM! They also do not block sounds from the hallway, so if anybody is talking within 75 feet of your door, you will hear the entire conversation. As for "smoke-free," the first room I was assigned smelled very much like the nearby casino. It reeked. The second room had just a hint of old tobacco, but it was tolerable and I didn't want to risk trying a third room after my experience with the first room! One of the housekeepers told me the lower floors are more smoke free than the upper, and it is true that my second room was on a lower floor than my first. A couple of small hassles -- washrags were scarce. I didn't see one until my 4th day! Also, the scrambled eggs at the complimentary breakfast were consistently the worst I've ever eaten, which is ironic because the rest of the breakfast was decent, especially considering that most of the hotels in the area do not provide free breakfast. In fact, during the week, the hotel also provides a small supper meal, complete with free drinks, for those who may not have time or funds to eat in style every evening. Other plusses at the hotel were a fine business center with free printing, free internet throughout the hotel, a congenial desk staff, and a location convenient to the waterfront, the French Quarter, the Convention Center, the Casino, and the Aquarium.

Reviews.Title: “Solid”
Reviews.Author: edleo13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at the Staybridge Suites New Orleans. We were in town for the BCS Title Game. GEAUX TIGERS!! Location: Good safe location on the corner of Tchoupitoulas and Poydras. Hotel is 8 blocks from the Superdome. 2 blocks from the Riverwalk. 1 block from Harrah's. 6 blocks from Bourbon. 5 blocks from the Convention Center. 8 blocks from Jackson Sqaure. Approx. 10 blocks from the French Market. (You get the picture - you can pretty much walk anywhere in about 10-15 minutes.) Rooms: We had a 1 room studio (1 and 2 bedroom suites are also available). Room was typical mid-class hotel fare however because Staybridge is an extended stay hotel, the room also had a small kitchen (fridge, dishwasher, sink, coffee pot, stove, etc.). Our room (713) had a nice view of Piazza d'Italia, Lowe's hotel, the W, Harrah's, etc. I found our king bed to very comfortable. A/C was central and very quiet (no window units here). Food: The hotel has a small pantry with snacks, frozen entrees, and drinks. It's open 24 hours a day (very convenient after a late night on Bourbon!). During the daytime, there are many convenients eating options nearby. Mother's is directly across the street. Harrah's Casino has a small food court, a buffett, and a couple of nicer restaurants. If you're looking for something nice, Tommy's Cuisine (NOLA/Italian mix) is located 3 blocks into the Warehouse District on Tchoupitoulas. Pros: The location is superb. If you plan to spend all of your time in downtown NOLA, the location can't be beat. I also found the front desk staff to be very friendly and helpful. Cons: Shower pressure was very weak. Housekeeping is only available during weekends on a by request basis (there's a cart parked near the elevator - we just replenished our towels ourselves on Saturday and Sunday). ALSO, the hotel currently has no guest parking. If you bring a car, you are on your own. There's a lot directly across the street but the meter in the lot only lets you buy a couple of days at a time (meaning if you stay longer, you will have to return to feed the meter again). We had no problems with this setup, but this could be really inconvenient for anyone who needs in/out privledges or doesn't have time to worry about parking meters. Overall we had a very nice stay at Staybridge Suites New Orleans and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Staybridge!”
Reviews.Author: OSU_Fan1967
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here recently for the BCS National Championship Game and we were very satisfied. We were the first people to stay in our one bedroom suite in the newly renovated warehouse building next to the main hotel. The suite was beautiful w/ engineered hardwood floors, granite counter tops in the kitchen and stainless steel appliances (including washer and dryer). The breakfast buffet hit the spot each morning and the food quality was average/typical. The location was ideal and quiet as the hotel is located close to the French Quarter but far enough away to allow for a good (quiet) night of sleep. We will definitely return to the Staybridge if our travels ever take us to New Orleans again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Price, Great Service... Bad Parking”
Reviews.Author: mikespiegs
Reviews.Content: Great Place. Hotel is super nice and clean, they provided a full breakfast with eggs, sausage, cereal, muffins, pancakes, fixins, etc. They also had a sundown reception when we were there with a mexican style buffet that was really nice (free beer, yay!). Room was really big with a couch and kitchen fully stocked with cooking utensils. They even have free laundry on site (although some of the machines were not working). Staff was super friendly and accomodating. We had a wonderful view of downtown and the river from our room on the top floor. Everywhere you want to go is within walking distance... The walk to the French Quarter is really short. Area is safe. I would recommend this place to anyone wanting to visit New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but that is it.”
Reviews.Author: fastrunningmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, just a short walk from the French Quarter. However that is about the best thing going for it. I had asked when we booked the hotel 4 months prior to arrival for adjoining rooms or 2 rooms very close by as we are a big family. I asked again a few days before arrival. The rooms given to us were 4 floors apart! We asked for something closer but were told that we could spend the second night in a suite for all of us, but we declined as I did not want to pack up again. Then one of my kids got a pillow for another kid from the closet so they could sit and watch ESPN. My son smelled onions (!) and turned the pillow over, there was a lump which when we looked in the pillowcase was a half eaten dried out sub! So gross. Obviously no one had changed the pillowcase or the sub would have fallen out. I asked that the linens be changed because I was so disgusted, and they at least did that. I do not think the level of cleanliness or service is up to par, even for a moderate hotel. Will definitely not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain, great for families with kids”
Reviews.Author: panama0520
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for one night, on August 1, 2007. I booked the hotel thru their website, mainly because of its location. We wanted to be close to the Aquarium and the Riverwalk. Here is our review of pro's and con's with this hotel Pro's * Great location * Sundown reception- Awesome. The night we were there they had hamburgers and hot dogs, perfect for us since we had our 3 kids with us. They also offered wine and beer, all free of charge. * Breakfast also included in your rate. * Appliances in all the suites. We had a full size refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher, toaster, coffee maker and a small (2 burner) range. * We had a studio with 2 double beds and a pull out couch, it was big enough for all of us. * Ironing board/iron/hair dryer all in the room * Room was clean (except for the towel- see below) * Goody bag upon check in, which included a handy map of the city. Con's *No vallet parking. We parked across the street, for about $25/day. *There was no one to help with the bags, which was quite challenging when you are dealing with 3 small kids plus bags. * Signs of wear on the carpet, definitely needs replacing. * A dirty towel still hanging in the bathroom. We called and asked for clean towels, since we weren't sure about the ones who were in the room. Not a problem. There is a pool at the hotel, just 5 ft deep. It's on a courtyard, so the water was very cold. Not a bad thing on a hot summer day, unless you want a big pool. Overall we had a great stay and will stay at this hotel on our next trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Like home with new friends!!!”
Reviews.Author: mistalong
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel you want to stay in if you want to be right in the center of things but want to pay a little less! Staybridge was absolutely excellent! Its right across from The "W", a block from Harrahs, a 5 minute walk to the convention center, and across the street from the World Famous "Mothers Restaurant". I went during a festival weekend and the staff and management were excellent. Because they were booked to capacity, both the Operations Manager and General manager were on site 24 hours to make sure the guests were taken care of. There was a hot breakfast and plenty of space in the rooms with modern amenities. People I know who stayed at the "W" wish they stayed there because it was cheaper, with more space, breakfast, and modern. This is New Orleans Best kept secret!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: jorsini
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Jazz Fest and enjoyed our stay at the Staybridge Suites! Major strengths: * Best hotel BED I have ever stayed in - much more comfortable than what we have at home * Modern conveniences easily accessable such as FREE access to PC's, printers, etc. * Full FREE continental breakfasts including fresh belgian waffles, etc. * Very spacious rooms that could easily accommodate two couples or large families * Clean accommodations * Kitchen in room * Great location (right across the street from Harrah's and Mother's) What Staybridge Suites lacks in the French New Orleans decor/style shown in other hotels, it surely makes up for it in all other areas.

Reviews.Title: “The only place we will stay”
Reviews.Author: chrisvnardmore
Reviews.Content: We Pricelined this hotel for $100 a night for the saturday before Mardi Gras. We got there and were told our room was ready at 11am. I called ahead and was told the crews stayed here alot and parking may be tough, so we parked at the airport and took a shuttle in. We were only supposed to be here one night but since it was nice we decided to add another night and cancel our room on Bourbon. Since we didn't have a reservation I figured our price would go up but it didn't. The room was vey spacious and right on the parade route. Very convenient. There were quite a few families here. We didn't bring our kids but are planning on it next year and this is definitely where we will stay. It has plenty of room and a full kitchen. The area is safe and just a few blocks from Bourbon and the Riverwalk. The staff were outstanding and obviously overworked but great. I can't say enough about the hotel staff and the room. It was clean, nice and vry functional. We love upper scale hotels but cancelled ours to stay where the people were nice and the room was ready.

Reviews.Title: “Staybridge was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: lilacwine6
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed during Mardi Gras and were VERY pleased. I am from Louisiana and have stayed in many New Orleans hotels during Mardi Gras. This was such a deal ... we paid over $100 less than all other available hotels were charging. The location is very convenient, the room was very nice (HUGE, full-size fridge/freezer in the kitchen, nice bathroom, great view), and the staff was polite and helpful throughout our stay. I'm planning on booking again for Jazz Fest!

HotelInfo.Name: Staybridge Suites New Orleans
HotelInfo.Address: 501 Tchoupitoulas St., at Poydras, New Orleans, LA 70130
